snippet: Gunfights between pro- and anti-Syrian groups left at least 7 people dead and 22 wounded.
abstract: Sectarian tensions between supporters and opponents of the Syrian government reignite street fighting in the northern Lebanese port city of Tripoli, with local news media reporting that at least 7 people are killed and 30 wounded; Tripoli has been a tinderbox throughout the Syrian uprising because the same sects at odds in Syria live in adjacent neighborhoods there.
lead_paragraph: Gunfights between pro- and anti-Syrian groups left at least 7 people dead and 22 wounded.

headline.seo: In Tripoli, Lebanon, a Deadly Battle Over Syrian Conflict
headline.main: In a Lebanese City, Fighting Over Syria Conflict Is Deadly
headline.print_headline: In a Lebanese City, Fighting Over Syria Conflict Is Deadly

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
